you guys noticed my e/j exit..  
i will explain you might find it useful..  
two things were done on that trade which only and only relates to traders ability and skill which comes with experience, mental control and it is vital to one's success in market trading..  
1) I did not quickly fold or **panic** when trade went against me so rapidly.. I let it settle out of the quick burst and sure risked getting the sl hit..(but since its within my range of my comfort risk, its ok)  
2) did not get **greedy** and closed it for minimal loss once PA presented the opportunity.  
not hoping or gettinggreedy to say, ok, now it will burst up to the upper band, let's wait to make profit out of it... now why? bcz i know my trading style.. our trading style is base on momentum release.. if don't pan out to that its time to look for the best way to get out for lesser loss..  
PA and chart most times talks to us..   
however there is a thin line between not making a panicy, premature exit and not waiting too long to exit.. and it comes with experience and many many trades executions under one's belt..  
  
this is called my friends... being in control of situation and not the other way.  
we got no set MM here... but this kinds of Live trades could show you different looks and forms in order to help you make your arsenal of trading better, i hope.  
  
  
now... try to EA that.. lol  
  
  
Dean

Hey Guys,  
  
In response to some questions from earlier, I would like  
to throw in my 2 cents. There are many ways to trade this  
and I urge you to put the time in as this is a golden method.  
  
Personally I will not be taking trades from the 60 minute (or less)  
stochastic, only in the direction of the 4 hour (if it looks "right")  
which I will explain here: in the first picture you see that the Euro  
is saying 4hour is Up but when you look at the 4 hour chart with  
the 10,3,3 linear weighted stochastic, it hasn't had a bullish   
cross yet and it's a very strong down trend for the last 4 bars.  
  
This doesn't look "right" to me and I will ignore the long trade.  
  
So far during the last few hours I have had 3 winning trades,  
(pound, nz and cad) based on the 4 hour. For me there are enough  
"high quality" opportunities per day with this method that I will  
ignore setups from the lower timeframe.

PLEASE if you really want to learn Forex open a live account and use 0.01 lots   
  
You will see

If any of you use scripts to set your buy or sell and are MQL savvy you can put this in your script to save a screenshot at time of entry in the experts/files dir   
  
if (TakeScreenShot == true)  
if(!WindowScreenShot(StringConcatenate(NAME + "-" + Symbol(),"-",Period(),"-",TimeToStr(TimeCurrent(),TIME_DATE),"-",Hour(),"H",Minute(),".gif"),size_x,size_y))   
Print(GetLastError());   
  
and declare your variables  
  
extern bool TakeScreenShot = true;  
extern int size_x = 1280;  
extern int size_y = 720;  
  
Please dont ask for my script as its not mine and I dont want to release it due to copyright  
  
also set your scripts up as hotkeys ie ALT B buy ALT S sell

I am glad to see that you are now able to take the correct entries.  
  
Very shortly you will be able to anticipate the entries and not need to worry so much about where the PA is in relation to the bands and RF finder but don't worry about that for now.  
  
What you need to remember is that 99.9 % of indicators (the only exclusion being indicators dealing with volume only) is only showing you PA but in a slightly different way, after a while your brain will automatically see what the indicator will do based purely on what you are seeing in terms of PA.

I use the simplest method available  
  
i take a chart, i look at the lh side and see where the price was, i look at the rh side and see where the price is  
  
if rh is clearly lower then downtrend, rh clearly higher then uptrend, otherwise rangebound  
  
simple but effective  
  
so for me (regardless what the stochs say) i see  
  
gu down  
eu down  
au down  
usdchf rangebound  
ej down  
usdcad rangebound  
  
BUT this is my opinion only

there is the 1-Retracement Finder by mediator - NOTE, this only checks the 60m stoch and has a bug in it where it checks for Stoch EMA on High/Low instead of Stoch LWMA on Close/Close  
  
there is the !RF Double Stoch posted by me a few days ago, this only checks the stochs and RF  
  
there is the !Retrace Finder posted by me yesterday (for this indi to work you need to have "TMA Called" in your MT4), this only alerts on the RF,Stochs AND TMA being in alignment

I thought you were getting the idea, now you seem to have gone backwards  
  
Why would you enter a long EURCHF  
  
and don't say because the 4hr stoch turned upwards, just because the long term stoch terms upwards doesn't necessarily mean the trend has changed.  
  
for instance, if the stoch goes up by 0.00001 greater than the previous it will be classed as upwards  
  
Be EXTREMELY careful of stoch changes especially when in extreme OB/OS conditions  
  
make sure the stoch has changed by some distance and for a number of bars  
  
In your conversations with P.Porter you agreed the trend was down, nothing has changed since then.  
  
The idea with the Up/Down indication is purely for help. A computer does not care if it is 0.00001 greater than the previous or 50.00000 it classes both as UP.

This is applicable to ALL systems you try out, not just this one   
  
just because the rules say to go long, look at what the PA is telling you  
  
maybe in the trading systems thread we should ban the word "rules" and use "guidelines" instead  
  
General -   
  
Trying to catch the beginning of a trend change is extremely hard and you will be burnt 9 times out of 10  
A trend once established will ALWAYS have at least one retracement where you can enter  
  
For this method -  
The thread is called retracement - if you don't have a retracement then you shouldn't be entering (and here I mean a PA retracement not the retracement finder indicator going red/blue/magenta.... whatever color)  
The exception of course is with the short term band 2 band method when the market is ranging, because then it is just zig-zagging between the bands

The problem is that the indi's are 'custom' indi's. Custom indis invariably consist of calls to standard indi's.  
  
TMA With Distance, for example, makes several calls to other indicators. This happens at each tick over several charts. The system uses three custom indi's, so the cpu takes a hammering.  
  
Mostly this is not a problem, but becomes one if you have much more going on in the background.  
  
The solution is a brand-spanking new computer with the latest mega-memory and cpu that will blow a hole in warp-space.  
  
No, I haven't got one either. Hey ho. I restrict myself to the 5 charts recommended by Kevin, so my machine keeps on running.

DAMMMMMMMM  
  
this is where have certain hard rules can go against you  
  
I never use more than a 20pip stop, sometimes less depending on the swing low  
  
EURUSD trade ([http://www.forexfactory.com/showthre...=1#post4723689](http://www.forexfactory.com/showthread.php?p=4723689&posted=1#post4723689))  
  
If i had placed my stop at the swing low (which would have meant a 29pip stop), not only would my trade have survived but hit it's take profit  
  
This is why correct placement of stops is important, maybe my 20pip rule will not work with this method  
  
and either - don't take a trade when sl would be more than 20pips or get rid of my max sl rule altogether.  
  
decisions, decisions

It's VERY rare to find a straight up technical system that works great as a stand alone system, think about it for a minute - what if our system is giving us an alert to buy right in an area where "the big boys" are unloading their inventory, who's going to win that trade - your $20 or their $20M ?  
  
  
If you do learn some price action (most importantly supply/demand) then you will be able to see where the pros have a lot of orders in (just waiting) to buy or sell at certain levels. Then you can position yourself in the right direction and scalp all day long with this awesome short-term market timing system.   
  
That's my approach and it's going great, I'm really pleased with this method's ability to time and show exactly where the entrances and exits are.   
  
To learn the supply and demand, I recommend to watch all of these webinars and study them, it will pay off big.

Hi HappyHappy/All  
  
just watched a few of the webinars, one that was VERY interesting when combined with this method is the one on CCI & Stochastics.  
  
In the original rules of this method we enter on after the first bar in the Retrace Finder in the direction of our trade, ie. for long the first bar where the CCI was greater than 0, for short the first bar where the CCI was less than 0  
  
In the webinar he mentions using CCI & Stochs (either one works) and using the "turn" (although it is easier to see on the stochs as you also have the signal line)  
  
This combats the problem I have often found that by the time the CCI confirms the trade, the price is often past the mid-line which makes for a riskier trade.  
  
However the important point to note is, that it is very important which OB/OS signals to take (he uses +100/-100 for OB/OS on CCI)  
  
so in this method for MOM trades if the 4hr stoch is up, then you only take OS signals, 4hr stoch down only take OB signals.  
  
As I have non-repainting versions of all indicators I have visually looked and the signals generated are usually 1 to 2 candles earlier, which means   
a) less problems with the mid-line  
b) reduced risk on SL as you are entering sooner after the swing low/high  
  
As it's quite late here, will be running thru a full forward test tomorrow for MOM trades only.  
  
I will post a report on my findings (as the only true method of testing is forward testing)  
  
Best Regards  
John

I also have another screen which has daily charts so I make sure that I'm not missing anything.

hi happy and all,  
listen brother... just live trade what and all that you know,and less talk.. with respect..  
  
nothing is for certain.. you won't be able to read big boys next move by just chart trading.. chart trading is a secondarily way of trading.. and you and I and we know nothing unless we are one of the insiders or the actual big guns... supply and demand will go opposite or for anytime as wished to do whats right for them.. mass of cash will change any god damn s/p s/r etc, line on yours and my chart..  
the best is to not worship whats laid on the chart but to see the true PA ,use other stuff just as compliments and figure out when they make sense to the actual action at hand.. in here we use some indies as guides but they don't and should not rule what we do.. 2/3 of all alert signals are to be eliminated and scanned.. indies help somewhat to scan quicker in the heat of the daily battle when filliping pages..  
no matter where the s/p lines are or are not.. when PA is ranging.. the damn thing is ranging and if the channel is wide enough one might be able to put up some ping pong action.. and if it's Trending than, where better to get in than MOM setup.. that's your real buying cheap selling high or opposite .. and more importantly if it goes wrong your sl as a back up is not too far from entry to keep the avg loss in-check.  
  
  
to everyone,  
  
for this system there is one thing vital before putting up a trade..  
  
**is the currency pair in RANGE.. or.. TRENDING.. action**  
  
what helps you with that?.. it's simple..  
daily range.. the band's angel.. current swing.. and then the 4hr stoach..  
  
know this little thing before doing any action..  
if it ranging, ping pong it ass.. if it's trending, wait for MOM..

I was getting ready for lunch when I saw the first screen - it looked so so, I mean not good and not bad either. Made a long entry - and was catastrophic - London lunch time and effort to catch the very beginning of the next movement. I did'nt realise the Stochs were pointing down. I got my ass beaten. I was hoping for 1.2.3. to develop and pop in the wave.  
  
I came back from lunch and got in for long again, took a lot of heat and seeing the bullish divergence decided to give it a try. Made 23 pips, took profit at .4300.   
  
To recap. It is not always wise to get in as soon as potential signal is appearing. ...   
  
I apologize for the hindsight charts but since I'm not a full time trader and work for an institution so it's kinda tricky to do both. ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f61c.png?v=15.1)

EDIT: There is one issue with QQE.  
  
It does not repaint at all since the dots become visible. However... however... When you try to refresh the indi let's say you want to change color of the line or recall the indicator to see the settings and click OK - it changes position afterwards, recalculating after some candles appear.  
  
So there are potential losses but hence we use the TMA, RF and the Stochastics it can yield some good/excellent results.  
Ohhh, btw. I don't think I will enter the market in between London break again.

A little clarification:-  
  
I normally am not able to trade early in the week due to other commitments, therefore when using this system profitably in the last few weeks it has always been towards the end of the week, by which time the market was generally in an easily definable trend.  
  
Therefore when previously trading I quite simply did not bother with the "shorter" term method which is more suited to ranging / breakout type markets.  
  
Today (and yesterday) were more of what I term as range / breakout days, for a while they moved sideways (or slightly down/up) then suddenly exploded in a direction.  
  
As I haven't been using the "shorter" term method available, I simply tried to trade today using MOM definitions, which didn't work and the market summarily kicked my ass.  
  
Hence being found guilty of wanton neglect - the trading methodology here has two methods - I was guilty of trying to use the wrong method in the wrong market type.  
  
Sometimes it's good to get your ass kicked, it makes the lesson easier to remember....

One for most.. this pair is and was at the time of your entry in a super range mood (under 30 daily range).. you need enough room to even play ping pong.. lol  
Two.. super narrow band.. not enough to get in and get out for good enough profit, if and when it does go in your direction considering the spread and the buffer (which is wise to use) to come out ahead at the end.  
Three.. your entry is close to the bottom of the band.. this kind of signals should be filtered..  
  
and Forth.. and this is only a recommendation..  
try to wait for the RF bar candle to close before entry... it will save you a lot of false breaks.. this is what i do.. you don't have to do it.  
sure it will result in some later entry or miss the signal.. but in other hand it will save you a lot of quick turnaround loss that leaves a super sour test.. you all know what I mean.. lol  
  
oh forgot the last one... don't even bother with this pair.. it's historically a volatile-less pair.. I just keep eye on it for fun thou.. lol  
  
I hope it helps.

Hi All  
  
don't know if this helps anyone else, but for me I find it useful,  
  
I ignore the direction/colors of the 4hr stoch once it is in OB/OS  
  
I just assume that while it remains in OB it is bullish, OS it is bearish  
  
Reason being is that we are looking at the 4hr stoch on a 5m timeframe, it can remain in OB/OS for a longgggg time, just because it has move slightly down / up, while it is on the OB/OS zone doesn't necessarily mean the trend has changed.  
  
Of course once it is out of these zones then the color/direction matters.  
  
Just my observation of course, for me it's helped.  
  
Regards, John

Hi Johntan  
  
it is not a must, but gives you less risk.  
  
The TMA bands can be thought of as another oscillator  
  
the upper band is Overbought, the lower band is Oversold  
  
General rule of thumb for oscillators is you try to buy close to oversold, sell close to overbought  
  
A lot of people use the mid-line of the TMA as the latest possible risk, although be aware in strongly trending markets the price may not retrace to even the mid-line.  
  
Regards, John

Hi Globalinvest  
  
the problem is the indicator you are basing your alert on.  
  
the color stochastic indicator you attached, simply compares the current stochastic value with the previous, and paints all lines in that time period with the same value.  
  
so in theory on an hourly stoch the following could happen  
  
open of the hour, stoch is up  
15m into the hour, stoch is down  
30m into the hour, stoch is equal  
45m into the hour stoch is up again  
  
on the indicator you are using all you would see is the final value, which is up, but during the hour it went down then back up,  
  
Regards, John

yeah, I think you missed the point I was trying to make  
  
this indicator repaints the current bar (like all indicator) - but remember this is the current bar on the other timeframe  
  
so my example again of 1hr MTF stoch, on a 5m chart  
  
12 5m bars make up the hour  
  
so when it repaints the current bar on the MTF timeframe, it can repaint upto 11 candles back on the 5m  
  
only when the hour bar is closed, is the 12 5m candles that make up that bar not repainted anymore.

I am going to give you guys a tip in regards to MOM trade when it don't fit into perfect setup scenario and ends up missing out on profit opportunities..  
  
I have displayed a chart from yesterdays A/U action.. as you all see it was in a slow bullish move all day.. which it did not give us the perfect mom setup while it was moving on with momentum behind it..   
so the problem is.. at times it does not come in although way to make a opposite band touch before releasing with energy for possible profit..  
so i recommend.. when you see such PA... disregard the band only if you got the 3 points below in line..  
watch the chart..  
disregard the perfect band touch.. if:  
1) both 4hr and 1hr (30m) are in the same direction  
2) CCI to be OS on buy and OB on sell..(this could be the substitute of band for you in this case only)  
3) when you got a minimum +10 pips gap between your entry point based of RF to HH/LL..  
  
if these three criteria is meet.. go for it regardless of the Price touching the opposite band.. all you need is a good enough PB to get on such rides.  
  
this past week I personally made a lot of positive pips on such plays.. the important point in the MOM trade is that the MOMENTUM is there.. if yes..than don't let the arrival of perfect setup to stand in your way of profitability.  
  
I hope it helps you out.

I froze this picture to show how a trader should be better than his indicators at times and see the true action..  
  
as you all see everything looks like a perfect MOM setup to be made..  
but to me this one is a trap..  
sure the pair is trending.. sure it has pulled back.. sure it had touch the opposite band.. sure the stochs are in-lined well enough..   
but.. the pair simply has got exhausted because of the one way street release of energy all at once for a +130pips move straight.. so the release of energy may not be there for such MOM setups and most likely will turn into a fake out..  
the right move on this pair was earlier today from the get go inside the band... i was in it and decided to take the money at the touch of the lower band.. but since it was a strong break it was worth to keep it for longer and bigger profit.. it could not turn any better this.  
  
price will tell you the true picture of the action.. one must distinguish when and where his beloved indicators will fail him.  
  
this is just my views.. do and take out, what makes sense to you.

no,  
  
you have entered a buy when the 4hr stoch is clearly down  
  
a mom trade is inline with the 4hr stoch from the opposite band  
  
ie. 4hr stoch down, sell trade from upper band  
4hr stoch up, buy trade from lower band  
  
I would suggest you read the rules again.  
  
regards, John

oh my mistake then.. my apology..  
  
sure i give it out..   
but I also said if i see enough interest as i don't want people to think I am forcing anything or show boating etc.. you know how one can get attacked for no reasons in forums in general.. you come with the best intention and get slammed all of sudden.. lol  
but i must warn its nothing super technical.. it's just something simple i use.  
  
  
ok to everyone..  
  
its called the 4th minute of the 5 minute candle..  
for example..  
when the RF signal goes off or you get a candle that is breaking back inside the band that your looking to get in the action off the OB or OS or mom.. instead of getting in right away on the first 3minutes of the candle or the beginning stage of it.. or waiting for the full candle to close and getting in on the next candle..  
instead of both those scenarios... **wait up to the arrival of the 4th minute of the candle**... IF it has shaped into solid candle in your direction than you can enter within that 4th minute... whatever the candle shape is up to the 4th minute it will most times stay the same or better and not change most times to completely a different look on the last minute of it..  
so if i choose to make a early entry it will be in this fashion.  
  
I hope it's find useful.. it's just a tip from a brother..

well John my friend.. what i have found is that people are full of comments, excitement and etc, when market is alive and kicking and other times not so much so.. when market is ranging and not alive most people lose money or not make as much so it's natural to either quit for the day or stay quiet, or worse go on tilt and not to come to talk about it.. lol  
but on the same token, the fact of the matter is that a Trader becomes "A Trader" when he can bear with these days the same as the good days... if you all ask me for example, I have learned and find tuned things awful a lot more on bad range/chop days verses the good alive trending days.. one's true skill would get build stronger from handling the range and choppy days no matter what system you use at some point you will have to face it.. sometimes its easy to avoid the range days in total, but chop days are impossible bcz it keeps you on your toes and it makes you think that this is the one that can run or make profit on..   
anyways, that's why i choose to stay more active even more on such days in forum bcz that's the time to help and get help and not to get bored mean time.. so its a win win situation.. and if everyone could do the same, i think only good could come out of it if trading is your goal and passion.  
  
for example the first two weeks of this thread.. market was really hot.. there was runs and runners left and right overall it was alive market.. the last two weeks, not so glamorous.. but the questions is in which period we learned more and made the necessary adjustments up to now so we can successed on both period and more importantly to avoid vanishing our accounts.. i think everyone should know the answer..  
i think John has been perfect example as to keep monitoring and coming up with different tools and etc, for better results.. but i don't think he would be as more active if he was making 50 100+ like the first week..  
so John my hats off to you bud.  
  
just some words from the guy next door everyone, don't take anything i say too serious.. lol

following up on john's post.. about one knowing his weakness/strength and exit..  
my weakness is to take action on every valid opportunities.. not being present all the time..   
  
but about exit... **i just go with amusing the worse at first always**.. IMHO its impossible to know , feel, assume or predict what kind of a market is in store for us starting our days out or even mid day or end of the day,, this damn thing can run or make sideways PA on a blink.. as soon as one decides to scalp for the day.. market will take one direction on one signal and runs to the moon and when decides go for runners, market will go sideways till you get sick to your stomach.. both can result in damages once market fuck with the mental..  
so, when I enter a trade on top of the key (bands ob/os) my first intention/expectations out that trade is to exit at the other side of the band if its not presented with a clear strong break of the band.. so on other word i start as a scalp mentality and **what i get beyond it would be a bonus** ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f609.png?v=15.1).. even though i really gun for longer profit, a runner like.. it's only kept in back of my mind but with hawks eye on the band price action.. so I would not hesitate to take the profit on wishy-washy action at the band.. I actually grade myself on such exits.. other day i made terrible decision on banking with G/U while it was a clear strong break of the band.. i got +17 PA ran for 120.. me as a trader that little part is a make or break for me.. and it's superbly vital in this system to not exit prematurely on clean strong break when its visible easily..   
  
now, this works with this system.. for two reasons.. 1) bcz we get plenty of opportunities even on rangy sluggish days, so a +5 +10 here and there will sum up to a good amount at end of the day like docrock results..2) this system skins the cat in two ways... ranging market and trending market.. so could be always in the action to get your chunk.  
with these two luxury at hand.. it's ok to bank less than your risk.. our true risk in most setups is 20 25pips.. but with high hit ratio when banking +10's.. you can make pretty good bottom line at the end of the week or month even on most days..  
that's my take on the exit issue.  
  
again this is just me.. do what makes sense to you.. what fits your plan and goals and simply what seems right for you overall.

Hi Vicky,  
welcome to the thread..  
you wait for one of the stoch's to turn in the reversal direction normally the 1hr (30m) first.. and then more importantly you'll wait for the band to lose its form of striking in one direction and turns into a more of a settle or flat or semi flat at least before you take your first shot at it.. this only if you got a trend in your hand meaning 80-100 plus move in one direction..   
but also remember when your on a trend your mostly looking firstly for MOM trade.. meaning the first retrace at some point to reach the opposite band.. so this helps you to sit on your hands patiently to not get involve in the middle of the NO MAN's LAND.. you should know what that is: yes you guessed it.. the correction.  
  
I hope it helps.

Hi,  
keep it simple..  
SL.. above/below last HH/LL.. it could be sometimes at 10pips or 25pips.. PA needs breathing room..  
TP.. keep a eye on +10 on every trade.. than the reach of the band.. than the break or stall at the band.. than break of each level such as daily ranges..  
  
I highly recommend to not let yourself in control of any indicator to tell you what to do.. especially on exit.

Hi  
  
couple of points on your last trades:-  
  
EURGBP - why would you place a buy? the tma bands were clearly against you  
  
USDCHF - your trailing stop was too close, the entry was fine, the stop loss should have been about 0.81595, this has not been touched, by my rough calculations the price hasn't even gone up by more than 15 pips yet  
  
AUDJPY - couple of points, your fib placement, for me the fib should go on the whole of the wave, the first retracement that occurred was not nearly big enough to consider the second move down as a new wave  
However that said, with the price already well below the TMA bands, your first target should have been the zero line which it hit   
  
there are 2 main price areas you need to concentrate on in this method when in a trade, how the price reacts at the various band levels, and if using the fib, how the price reacts at the zero line  
  
unless it breaks through these areas with no problem you should be looking to exit  
  
All this has been explained numerous times in the forum, I suggest you go back and read again, particularly helpful are the posts from P.Dean.  
  
In regards to waves and fibs there are various resources and information available on this forum and the web  
  
Regards, John

AUDJPY - couple of points, your fib placement, for me the fib should go on the whole of the wave, the first retracement that occurred was not nearly big enough to consider the second move down as a new wave  
However that said, with the price already well below the TMA bands, your first target should have been the zero line which it hit   
  
**It was a long time ago that I studied fib., but I was egar to try them with this method, maybe I was too eager this time.**  
  
there are 2 main price areas you need to concentrate on in this method when in a trade, how the price reacts at the various band levels, and if using the fib, how the price reacts at the zero line  
  
unless it breaks through these areas with no problem you should be looking to exit  
  
All this has been explained numerous times in the forum, I suggest you go back and read again, particularly helpful are the posts from P.Dean.  
  
In regards to waves and fibs there are various resources and information available on this forum and the web  
  
**I read through the whole thread, but there are some controversal info, and different apporoaches. I try out every apporoach and also mix them for best results.  
  
Thank You for your answer!**

Hi Balasz227  
  
regarding the first point that I made regarding the TMA bands being against you, this is my personal take  
  
i will occasionally take these, if the price action gives me a reason, the fact that the CCI indicates short/long is not enough reason for me  
  
one method that serves me well, is to look for a 123 pattern to return me to the trend direction after a long retrace (and generally this also "flattens" out the TMA bands a bit)  
  
unfortunately the thread owner no longer participates in the thread, though I am sure that he has lots of filters he uses that he just didn't mention.  
  
P.Dean and others have tried to fill in these "missing" gaps with their own insights, likewise myself.  
  
In the end, what occurs is you take the basic methodology and apply your own style, in the end creating a system that YOU can work with (if you look at some of my later screenshots you will notice my screens do not have stochastics or cci)  
  
What works for others may not work for you.  
  
In the end 90% of the systems in this forum are basically the same, trend following - they may use different indicators but a lot of the entry signals are roughly the same, the reason being almost all indicators are based off candle prices (with the exception of volume indicators) therefore if one signals a buy/sell another one is likely to do so as well.  
  
Regards, John
